unnormalised: The pressure! Remember those days waiting for your Class 10th results? Sigh. We all have been there, right? Those marksheets felt like they defined everything! Well, they don't, but getting good marks *did* open doors. Even now, seeing "Passed Class X with Distinction" on that dusty old certificate brings back a flood of memories. My mom still keeps it safe along with my other 'achievements'.
normalised: The pressure! Remember those days waiting for your Class tenth results? Sigh. We all have been there, right? Those marksheets felt like they defined everything! Well, they don't, but getting good marks did open doors. Even now, seeing "Passed Class X with Distinction" on that dusty old certificate brings back a flood of memories. My mom still keeps it safe along with my other 'achievements'.

unnormalised: And then came Class XII. This one was a real game changer. Choosing between Science, Commerce, and Arts felt like the biggest decision of my life! I remember agonizing over which subjects to pick, thinking it would seal my fate. The final scorecard had "Completed Senior Secondary Education (CBSE)" emblazoned across the top. Good old CBSE. The % of marks I scored helped me get into a decent college.
normalised: And then came Class twelve. This one was a real game changer. Choosing between Science, Commerce, and Arts felt like the biggest decision of my life! I remember agonizing over which subjects to pick, thinking it would seal my fate. The final scorecard had "Completed Senior Secondary Education (C-B-S-E)" emblazoned across the top. Good old C-B-S-E. The percent of marks I scored helped me get into a decent college.

unnormalised: Talking about college… those degree certificates! My Bachelor of Engineering (B.E.) in Computer Science from BMS College, Bangalore, felt like a golden ticket at the time. Earning the "B.E." title after my name after 4 yrs felt great. I even have a separate certificate that mentions “First Class with Honours”! It hangs proudly on my wall, a reminder of all those late nights studying. I also earned a few extra certificates for winning inter-college coding competitions, all adding up to a pretty impressive resume, or so I thought back then.
normalised: Talking about college… those degree certificates! My Bachelor of Engineering (B-E) in Computer Science from B-M-S College, Bangalore, felt like a golden ticket at the time. Earning the "B-E" title after my name after four years felt great. I even have a separate certificate that mentions “First Class with Honours”! It hangs proudly on my wall, a reminder of all those late nights studying. I also earned a few extra certificates for winning inter-college coding competitions, all adding up to a pretty impressive resume, or so I thought back then.

unnormalised: Then came time for a master's degree. I decided to go for an MBA. My "Master of Business Administration (MBA)" degree from IIM Calcutta was a huge step up. The course was grueling but totally worth it. The certificate itself is just a piece of paper, but the skills and network I gained during those two years are priceless. I remember working super hard to be in the top 5% of the batch.
normalised: Then came time for a master's degree. I decided to go for an M-B-A. My "Master of Business Administration (M-B-A)" degree from I-I-M Calcutta was a huge step up. The course was grueling but totally worth it. The certificate itself is just a piece of paper, but the skills and network I gained during those two years are priceless. I remember working super hard to be in the top five percent of the batch.

unnormalised: But education doesn't stop there, does it? I've also collected certifications along the way. A "Project Management Professional (PMP)" certification after a gruelling exam was essential for moving into management. Then there's the "Certified Scrum Master (CSM)" I earned to better lead Agile teams. Each new certificate has helped me level up my career. I even got one for completing an online course - "AI for Business Leaders" from Coursera. Not bad, huh?
normalised: But education doesn't stop there, does it? I've also collected certifications along the way. A "Project Management Professional (P-M-P)" certification after a grueling exam was essential for moving into management. Then there's the "Certified Scrum Master (C-S-M)" I earned to better lead Agile teams. Each new certificate has helped me level up my career. I even got one for completing an online course - "A-I for Business Leaders" from Coursera. Not bad, huh?

unnormalised: So, while those school and college certificates might seem like relics of the past, each represents a step forward on our journey. And remember, it's not just about the certificates. It's about what you learn along the way and what those experiences enable you to achieve! Even that "Certificate of Participation" from the school drama competition back in 1998 holds a special place! Now that I look back at it, it does make me smile.
normalised: So, while those school and college certificates might seem like relics of the past, each represents a step forward on our journey. And remember, it's not just about the certificates. It's about what you learn along the way and what those experiences enable you to achieve! Even that "Certificate of Participation" from the school drama competition back in nineteen ninety eight holds a special place! Now that I look back at it, it does make me smile.
